Description: Tesla announced that all new vehicles would be equipped with Autopilot hardware, enabling semi-autonomous driving features and pioneering the path to full self-driving.
Tesla delivered the first 30 Model 3 vehicles at a handover event, beginning production of the highly anticipated mass-market electric car.
Tesla unveiled the Cybertruck, a revolutionary all-electric pickup truck with a futuristic stainless steel exoskeleton design that broke automotive conventions.
At AI Day, Tesla announced Optimus (Tesla Bot), a humanoid robot designed to perform dangerous, repetitive, or boring tasks, leveraging Tesla's AI and autopilot expertise.
At AI Day, Tesla officially unveiled Dojo, its custom AI supercomputer designed for training neural networks on massive amounts of video data for Full Self-Driving development.
Tesla began delivering the Cybertruck, four years after its reveal, with the first deliveries happening at the Gigafactory Texas delivery event.
Tesla unveiled Optimus Gen 2 humanoid robot via video update, showcasing dramatically improved motor control, walking speed, and dexterity with new hands capable of delicate tasks.
Tesla began wide rollout of FSD v12.3, the first end-to-end neural network-based Full Self-Driving system, replacing legacy code with AI trained on millions of video clips.
